name: Calculation1
dax_expression:
SWITCH(TRUE(),
  'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category] = "Furniture", "furniture",
  'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category] = "Office Supplies", "office supplier",
  'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category] = "Technology", "technology",
  'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category]
)
solution_explanation: Converted a Tableau IF/ELSEIF/ELSE row-level mapping into a DAX calculated column using SWITCH(TRUE()) to map Category values to corresponding labels. Returns the original Category when no condition matches.
type_changed_reason: This calculation applies row-level logic with no aggregation, so it should be created as a calculated column instead of a measure.
